atDirectives.description: Use `@apply` to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS. This is useful when you need to write custom CSS (like to override the styles in a third-party library) but still want to work with your design tokens and use the same syntax you're used to using in your HTML.
atDirectives.name: @apply

atDirectives.description: Use the `@layer` directive to tell Tailwind which "bucket" a set of custom styles belong to. Valid layers are `base`, `components`, and `utilities`.
atDirectives.name: @layer

atDirectives.description: Use the `@tailwind` directive to insert Tailwind's `base`, `components`, `utilities` and `variants` styles into your CSS.
atDirectives.name: @tailwind
